qas.question: In what European country has VRS services become well developed?
What is one of the reasons why VRS services are not in most European countries?
What European country is a leader in providing VRS services to its citizens?
What country is a world leader in providing VRS services?
What has become developed in Germany since 1997?
What has the European Union become a world leader in providing?
Why are VRS services not in the United States?
For how long has Germany offered VRS services since the 2000's?
Where has legislation and financing become well developed in Europe?

context: <b4_0>VRS services<b4_0/> have become well developed nationally in <a0_0><b8_0>Sweden<b8_0/><a0_0/> since 1997 and also in the United States since the first decade of the 2000s. With the exception of Sweden, VRS has been provided in Europe for <b7_0>only a few years<b7_0/> since the mid-2000s, and as of 2010 has not been made available in many European Union countries, with most European countries still lacking the legislation or the <a1_0><b6_0>financing<b6_0/><a1_0/> for large-scale VRS services, and to provide the necessary telecommunication equipment to deaf users. <a2_0>Germany<a2_0/> and the Nordic countries are among the other leaders in Europe, while the <a3_0>United States<a3_0/> is another world leader in the provisioning of <b5_0>VRS services<b5_0/>.
